questions.question: Who was the English mathematician and writer widely considered as the world's first computer programmer for her work on Charles Babbage's proposed mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine?
What is the capital city of Australia?
In which year did the Titanic sink?
Name the largest planet in our solar system.
Who wrote the play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
What is the chemical symbol for gold?
Which famous scientist developed the theory of general relativity?
How many continents are there on Earth?
What is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.answer: The blue whale, Balaenoptera musculus, is the largest mammal on Earth.

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
What is the square root of 144?
Which element has the chemical symbol 'O'?
Who wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.answer: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean on Earth.

questions.question: In which year did the United States declare its independence?
What is the capital of Japan?
Who is known as the 'Father of Computers'?
What is the boiling point of water in Celsius?
Which planet is known as the 'Red Planet'?
Who wrote the 'I Have a Dream' speech?
What is the largest desert in the world?
questions.answer: Antarctica is the largest desert on Earth.

questions.question: Who wrote '1984,' a dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian society?
Which planet is known as the 'Red Planet'?
In what year did the Berlin Wall fall, leading to the reunification of East and West Germany?
What is the chemical symbol for the element with atomic number 79?
Who is credited with the discovery of penicillin, the first widely used antibiotic?
Which famous scientist formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation?
What is the capital city of Brazil?
Name the largest ocean on Earth.
Who painted 'Starry Night,' a famous work of post-impressionist art?
What is the boiling point of water in Fahrenheit?
Which gas makes up the majority of Earth's atmosphere?
Who is known for the theory of relativity and the equation E=mc^2?
What is the capital of South Korea?
Which river is the longest in the world?
questions.answer: The Nile River is the longest river on Earth.

questions.question: In which year did the first moon landing occur?
Who is the author of the 'Harry Potter' book series?
What is the speed of light in a vacuum?
questions.answer: The speed of light is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.

questions.question: Which element has the chemical symbol 'Fe'?
Who invented the World Wide Web?
